description.narrative: Output 5.1: Enhanced capacities of stakeholders at all levels, including communities, for increased learning opportunities for out- of-school children and young people, and equitable access for and retention of disadvantaged children., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2020, all boys and girls, including young people, have increased and more equitable access to, and completion of, quality, inclusive education, with improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.1: Enhanced capacities of stakeholders at all levels, including communities, for increased learning opportunities for out- of-school children and young people, and equitable access for and retention of disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: The enrolment of children with disabilities increased by 38.1 per cent from 2018 (total 85,560 learners with 44.1 per cent female and 55.9 per cent male in 2019). UNICEF promoted access to inclusive quality education through direct assistance to disadvantaged schools and capacity building of education personnel. Around 98% of the targeted schools benefited from School Improvement Grant to address their minimum functionalities to provide education services. The number of schools with the school development committee increased from 8,593 in 2018 to 9,005 in 2019. UNICEF supported capacity building of school management committees through training and manual development. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
